text: Classify each of the following sports terminologies by sport: Earned Run Average, WHIP, Bicycle Kick, Touchdown, Safety, Quality Start, Runs, RBI, Stolen Base, Batting Average, Inning, Strikeout, Shortstop, Striker, Sweeper, Stopper, Relief Pitcher, Nutmeg, Slide Tackle, Extra Point, Barrel Rate, Midfielder, Yellow Card, Red Card, Corner Kick, Goal Kick, Set Piece, Direct Free Kick, FIFA, MLS, Concacaf, Half Volley, Full Volley, Base on Balls, Batter's Box, Mound, Breaking Ball, Slider, Designated Hitter, Knuckle Ball, No Hitter, Triple Play, Double Play, Wild Pitch, Linebacker, Running Back, Quarterback, Wide Receiver, Tight End, Chop Block
answer:
Earned run average (ERA) - The number of earned runs allowed per nine innings pitched.
WHIP - Walks and Hits Per Innings Pitches
Bicycle kick - A soccer kick with both feet used to propel the ball forward.
Touchdown - A touchdown is scored when a player crosses the goal line from behind the opposing team's goal line.
Safety - When a defensive player catches a pass in his own end zone before it reaches the opponent's end zone.
Quality start - A pitcher who has thrown at least six innings without allowing more than three earned runs.
Runs - Number of times a batter hits the ball for a hit

text: Identify which animal species is alive or extinct: Procoptodon, Polar Bear
answer:
Procoptodon was a large marsupial native to Australia and New Guinea. It had long legs and a short tail. The fur of this animal was dark brown with white spots on its back. Its diet consisted mainly of insects and small vertebrates. This animal became extinct in 1930 due to habitat loss and hunting for food.
Polar bears are a type of bear found in the Arctic region. They have a thick layer of fat under their skin, which helps them survive during the winter months when they cannot hunt. Their diet consists mostly of seals and other marine mammals.

This made it one of the largest carnivorous dinosaurs known.

text: Classify the following games in ascending order of computational complexity: tic-tac-toe, chess, checkers, go

Chess has O(n^3) time and space complexity where n is the number of players.
Checkers has O(1) time and space complexity
Go has O(n^4) time and space complexity where n is the number of players

text:
Identify the musical interval (e.g perfect fifth, major third) associated with the following pairs of notes: 
C-G 
G-B
E-A
C-Fsharp
Eflat-C
D-Csharp
B-F
answer:
The intervals between C and G are a perfect fifth and a major third respectively.
The intervals between G and B are a perfect fourth and a minor third respectively.
The intervals between E and A are a perfect fifth and a major second respectively.
The intervals between C and F sharp are a perfect fifth and a major sixth respectively.
The intervals between E flat and C are a perfect fourth and a minor seventh respectively.
The intervals between D and C sharp are a perfect fifth and a major ninth respectively.
The intervals between B and F are a perfect fourth and a minor eleventh respectively.

text: Explain telephone numbering system of Russia ?
answer:
The Russian telephone number system consists of three parts: area code, subscriber line and local number.
Area codes are used to identify different regions in Russia. The first digit of the area code indicates the region. For example, 8 for Moscow, 7 for St. Petersburg, etc.
Subscriber lines are used to identify specific numbers within each area code. Each subscriber line has its own unique number.
Local numbers are used to identify specific locations within a subscriber line. Local numbers can be either fixed or mobile numbers. Fixed numbers are assigned by the operator and cannot be changed. Mobile numbers are assigned by the user and can be changed at any

text:
Summarize the following paragraph about Microsoft in 2 sentences:

Microsoft Corporation is an American multinational technology corporation headquartered in Redmond, Washington. Microsoft's best-known software products are the Windows line of operating systems, the Microsoft Office suite, and the Internet Explorer and Edge web browsers. Its flagship hardware products are the Xbox video game consoles and the Microsoft Surface lineup of touchscreen personal computers. Microsoft ranked No. 14 in the 2022 Fortune 500 rankings of the largest United States corporations by total revenue;[2] it was the world's largest software maker by revenue as of 2022. It is considered as one of the Big Five American information technology companies, alongside Alphabet (parent company of Google), Amazon, Apple, and Meta (formerly Facebook).

Microsoft was founded by Bill Gates and Paul Allen on April 4, 1975, to develop and sell BASIC interpreters for the Altair 8800. It rose to dominate the personal computer operating system market with MS-DOS in the mid-1980s, followed by Windows. The company's 1986 initial public offering (IPO), and subsequent rise in its share price, created three billionaires and an estimated 12,000 millionaires among Microsoft employees. Since the 1990s, it has increasingly diversified from the operating system market and has made a number of corporate acquisitions, their largest being the acquisition of LinkedIn for $26.2 billion in December 2016,[3] followed by their acquisition of Skype Technologies for $8.5 billion in May 2011.[4]

As of 2015, Microsoft is market-dominant in the IBM PC compatible operating system market and the office software suite market, although it has lost the majority of the overall operating system market to Android.[5] The company also produces a wide range of other consumer and enterprise software for desktops, laptops, tabs, gadgets, and servers, including Internet search (with Bing), the digital services market (through MSN), mixed reality (HoloLens), cloud computing (Azure), and software development (Visual Studio).

This led to the creation of new types of financial instruments such as mortgage-backed securities and collateralized debt obligations, which became popular among investors. text: Without quoting the text, explain to me why the One Mile telescope was built

It consisted of two telescopes, each consisting of a parabolic dish antenna and a feed horn, connected by a waveguide. The OMT was capable of observing objects up to 1000 light years away, making it one of the most sensitive radio telescopes ever built.

text: What is measure of inflation in the US?
answer: The Consumer Price Index (CPI), which measures changes in the average cost of living over time, is one of the most widely used indicators of inflation. It is calculated by the Bureau of Labor Statistics (BLS) as the weighted average of a large number of individual price indexes for different categories of consumer goods and services. These include food, clothing, shelter, transportation, medical care, recreation, education, and other items. The weights assigned to these categories are based on their relative importance in the overall cost of living. For example, housing costs account for about 30% of the CPI while food accounts for only 10%.
